title: Ryan Giggs makes bizarre claim over Daniel James' horrific head injury scare
text:
Daniel James was ‘acting’, according to Wales manager Ryan Giggs (Picture: Getty)

Ryan Giggs insists Daniel James was just ‘acting’ as he went to ground following a head collision during Wales’ Euro 2020 qualifier with Croatia.

Gareth Bale’s well-taken strike right on half-time cancelled out Nikola Vlasic’s early opener and the points were shared at the Cardiff City Stadium on Sunday evening.

Much of the talk following the Group E clash surrounded a worrying incident midway through the first half involving James and Croatia defender Domagoj Vida.

Vida appeared to clatter into James’ head from behind and the Manchester United winger hit the turf with some force before Wales’ medical staff rushed onto the field.

James lay motionless on the turf after the collision (Picture: ESPN)

Though replays appeared to show James had been knocked out cold, the youngster passed the concussion protocol and played on for the remainder of the match.

Speaking after the final whistle, Wales manager Giggs claimed James made the most of the collision.

‘Daniel James went down and stayed down with a bit of acting,’ Giggs told Sky Sports.

‘But the medical staff went over, he was compos mentis and we did all the checks at half-time and he was fine.

James also played down the incident and insisted he never lost consciousness despite the seemingly-sickening blow.

‘There was a few tackles flying in but you always expect it in these games,’ he said.

‘I’m fine. I think he just caught me in the head but I didn’t get knocked out fortunately.’
